p: We next sought to determine if the dates we obtained were the result of clock-like signal within SIVsm or whether SIVsm had no clock-signal and we were inadvertently extrapolating HIV-2 rates across the entire tree. We compared the date estimates from gag, pol, and env to analyses where all non-SIVsm sequences were excluded. For all three genes, there were no significant differences in the tMRCAs between the full and SIVsm-only datasets in any of the clades measured, including all SIVsm ( Table 2). Furthermore, there was no significant difference between the SIVsm gag substitution rate we estimated of 1.38×10 −3 (1.03×10 −3–1.73×10 −3) substitutions/site/year and the HIV-2 group A substitution rate of 1.22×10 −3 substitutions/site/year estimated by Lemey et al. [7]. This similarity indicates that SIVsm does indeed have sufficient clock-like signal to date tMRCAs, and it does not appear to evolve at a different rate than HIV-2 group A, despite differences in host biology and pathogenicity.
